full_text:
Making use of the tutorial for these kinds of graphs that @tejfbanalytics went over in his YouTube video series, lets look at the #Seahawks PROE so far this season. Things trending downward with Geno Smith at the helm ahead of a week 6 matchup with the #Steelers. 
#nflverse https://t.co/zW5OlKgdBf
The #nflverse when GitHub Actions aren't working https://t.co/a7vthgT2v9

The #nflverse package nflplotR just got a nice update including a new ggplot2 geom for player headshots.
The only requirement is the player gsis ID and the geom will take care of the correct headshot. 
Details: https://t.co/n9UeclC8IA
cc: @_TanHo who asked me to add this feature https://t.co/bv5mAjbDCh

Do you want to know how to do the below plot with a few lines of code and the help of #nflverse?
Check the introduction to nflplotR:
https://t.co/CHPkOK6LIx https://t.co/wp7TYJbR8C

Efficiency when using pass/run in the redzone, Weeks 1-4.

Data: @nflfastR 

#nflverse https://t.co/uu7OIOUgzY

Pace and efficiency charts through week 4 - I think that Chiefs OL might be figuring things out.

#nflverse https://t.co/9UaPLpnOqY

Week 4 of NFL QB DICK Size... Scoring each QB by their Air Yards and Passing Touchdowns. Now includes week to week DICK movement. 

#nflverse #python #matplotlib https://t.co/MvRuCFmgwn

Week 4 Defensive EPA/P removing turnovers... Is the Cowboys defense for real or just benefiting from early season turnover luck? Red color in the DIFF column means defensive success heavily relies on turnovers. #python #matplotlib 

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/BtmhWiKffl

Do teams that run well also run more often? Not always. Comparing each team's Run EPA/P and Run rate.

Data: #nflverse https://t.co/kTULAYNflT

Checking out some PFF Play Action data before LV/CHI game: 

Derek Carr is using almost no play action yardage to support his league leading pass yards and getting no help from his run game either.

#nflverse https://t.co/UTg34aqceK

These Bears are running the ball well, even compared to previous ones. However, you can see only 1 team actually had a positive EPA/play running the ball since 2000. In fact, only above league average 5x since 2000.  

#nflverse https://t.co/IrsawarnFX

Who were the top ten receivers in average YAC in Week 4? (min. 4 receptions)
I present the #WeeklyMeanYACReport 
#nflverse https://t.co/MLWp7Rndx9

Looked at AFC West QB performance in 2020 - 1st 4 weeks of 2021 (min. 25 dropbacks) and the difference between Bridgewater and Lock in EPA/CPOE is notable.
Important Context: Lock has 4x # of snaps as Bridgewater (447/109) and was on an injury-riddled roster last year. #nflverse https://t.co/yRuTKy6XVG

AFC North QB Performance through Week 5, 2021. Lamar establishes himself as far and away the best QB in AFC North with recent performance, and #Steelers Ben Roethlisberger settles further into manager role. #nflverse https://t.co/KwIhYHknOZ

The KFL analytics blog is up! https://t.co/0FViih9CKE

Check out the full write up on expected wins and luck in the KFL. I'll tweet some interesting findings over the next couple days. Data tables to search and a year by year review using expected wins. #ffverse #KFL #nflverse

Hi, I just received my monthly charge of $60 from Heroku that keeps the database running on https://t.co/180MPXn68r.

If you enjoy the site, please consider becoming a monthly Patron (even $1/month helps!) to help cover the overhead costs.

#nflverse

NFL Efficiency Charts updated through week 4

KC breaking the axes on the offensive metrics chart, but their defense has allowed the most total EPA against, including 50%+ success rates rushing AND passing. 

#tableau #nflverse https://t.co/l1knyZC8N4

My games data has been updated to identify Rich Bisaccia as the Raiders head coach for the remaining 2021 games rather than Jon Gruden. #nflverse 

Good riddance.

Simple receiver version of the typical QB scatterplot. I normally do this in Python but it does look a lot nicer coming out of R. I'm learning!

#nflverse https://t.co/nKEldcdfzf

We're through Week 4 and the model has finally learned that the @steelers are probably awful üò¢ 

Full season proj are in line with other systems, but my model doesn't love the @BuffaloBills, with slightly more than half the prob of a SB win compared to @FiveThirtyEight #nflverse https://t.co/2zq0HR3AuR https://t.co/l40Cs2XFNx

On a weekly projection level, the model did a nice job of picking winners last week, though it was overconfident on the wrong games - looking at you @MiamiDolphins, and I need to revisit the weight of pre-season team strength estimates, but here are this week's picks #nflverse https://t.co/MZA3QYfHo8
Last but not least, team strength estimates #nflverse https://t.co/o1YfVEfDiF

#Giants 3/3 on 3rd down to Golladay, still throwing behind the maker too much!

2021 season, after 4 games:
-Throw behind marker: 3/13 (23%)
-Throw at marker: 3/9 (33%)
-Throw past marker: 10/12 (83%)

Lamar wasn't holding onto the ball unusually long in Week 4 like he did in Week 3, but his aDOT was still top 5 in his career. The big Q: will he continue to push the ball downfield, or is this just a by-product of recent defensive game plans? #nflverse https://t.co/JWE1DYPVqc
